    • Uses of GOALException in goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions

      Subclasses of GOALException in goal.tools.errorhandling.exceptions 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GOALCommandCancelledException
      Represents a GOAL IDE command that failed because it was cancelled halfway by the user.
      class  GOALEnvironmentActionFailureException
      Use this when the environment failed to perform an action and throws an ActException.FAILURE or an ActException.NOTSPECIFIC.
      class  GOALIncompleteGUIUsageException
      Represents a GOAL IDE command that failed because the user did not follow a protocol, select the right files, etc.
      class  GOALLaunchFailureException 
      class  GOALParseException
      Represents a throwable error that serves as a notification that an attempt to parse a string/file failed.
      class  GOALUserError
      An exception that serves as a notification of the fact that we could not handle something that the user did.
      class  GOALWarning
      Represents a throwable error that only serves as a warning.
      If this is thrown by a Validator, the object it is validating is not invalidated by this exception, although something else might still invalidate the object.
